revised_title: Anatomy and Description of the Ornithorhynchus paradoxus
tldr: The author provides a detailed description of the anatomy and physiology of the Ornithorhynchus paradoxus, an unusual mammal found in New South Wales. The article discusses the animal's appearance, habitat, and unique features such as its bill structure, webbed feet, and the absence of external genitalia. The author also describes the animal's behavior, diet, and the way it is hunted by the natives.
